requirement_tested: A frontend dashboard interface that displays financial data from multiple companies
user_persona: A financial analyst named Sarah who needs to monitor the performance of several client companies.
user_goal: Sarah wants to quickly navigate to a specific company's financial details from the main dashboard.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing the Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Sarah logs in and lands on the main dashboard which shows an overview of all her client companies with key metrics.
narrative_steps.action: Load the dashboard page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The dashboard loads successfully, showing company cards with names, logos, and key financial indicators like revenue and profit margin against a mint cream background with teal accents.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Company Details
narrative_steps.description: Sarah identifies the card for 'TechCorp' and clicks on it to view detailed financial data.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'TechCorp' company card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page navigates to TechCorpâ€™s detailed financial page, displaying its specific financial records and charts.

requirement_tested: A backend API service that connects to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A developer named Alex responsible for setting up the backend infrastructure.
user_goal: Alex wants to ensure the backend service connects correctly to the PostgreSQL database using predefined environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Service
narrative_steps.description: Alex starts the backend service after configuring the required environment variables for PostgreSQL connection.
narrative_steps.action: Run the backend server with environment variables set.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The backend initializes successfully and establishes a connection pool to the PostgreSQL database using DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, etc.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Database Schema
narrative_steps.description: Alex checks if the necessary tables are created and accessible via the connected database.
narrative_steps.action: Query the database for the existence of `companies` and `financial_data` tables.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both `companies` and `financial_data` tables exist with correct schema definitions including foreign key relationships.

requirement_tested: User authentication and authorization system to manage access to financial data
user_persona: A new user, Jordan, trying to access the dashboard for the first time.
user_goal: Jordan needs to log into the system to gain access to the financial dashboard.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Protected Route
narrative_steps.description: Jordan tries to go directly to the dashboard URL but is redirected to the login page since he's not authenticated.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the dashboard route without logging in.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to the login form with fields for username and password.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: Jordan enters his valid credentials and clicks the login button.
narrative_steps.action: Enter username and password, then click the 'Login' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard with a welcome message displayed.

requirement_tested: Company management module allowing users to add, edit, and remove company profiles
user_persona: An admin user, Taylor, tasked with maintaining company information in the system.
user_goal: Taylor wants to add a new company profile to the system.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Add Company Form
narrative_steps.description: Taylor navigates to the company management section and clicks the 'Add Company' button.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Add Company' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal form appears with fields for name, industry, and contact email.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting New Company
narrative_steps.description: Taylor fills out the form with 'InnovateX', 'Technology', and 'contact@innovatex.com', then clicks save.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in company details and click 'Save'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The new company 'InnovateX' is added to the company list, and the modal closes.

requirement_tested: Financial data ingestion capability to collect and store financial information per company
user_persona: A finance manager, Morgan, who needs to input quarterly financial results for a company.
user_goal: Morgan wants to manually enter financial data for Q1 results of 'GlobalTrade Inc.'

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Data Entry Section
narrative_steps.description: Morgan navigates to GlobalTrade Inc.'s detail page and selects the 'Upload Financial Data' tab.
narrative_steps.action: Go to the company's detail page and click on the 'Upload Financial Data' tab.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Manual entry form with fields for date, revenue, expenses, and profit becomes visible.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Financial Data
narrative_steps.description: Morgan inputs the Q1 financials: Date = 2023-03-31, Revenue = 500000, Expenses = 300000, Profit = 200000.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in the manual entry form fields and click 'Submit Manual Entry'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The financial record is saved in the database and reflected in the company's financial view.

requirement_tested: Data visualization components for displaying financial metrics and trends
user_persona: A business executive, Riley, reviewing quarterly performance visually.
user_goal: Riley wants to analyze revenue trends for 'EcoSolutions Ltd.' using interactive charts.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Financial Charts
narrative_steps.description: Riley visits EcoSolutions Ltd.'s financial page and sees various charts showing revenue trends over time.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the company's financial detail page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Charts load dynamically showing revenue trends, expense breakdowns, and profitability ratios.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting With Chart Elements
narrative_steps.description: Riley hovers over a point on the revenue line chart to get exact figures.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over a data point on the chart.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A tooltip appears showing the exact date and revenue value for that point.

requirement_tested: Consolidated reporting feature that aggregates financial data across all companies
user_persona: A CFO, Casey, preparing a board report summarizing overall company performance.
user_goal: Casey wants to generate a consolidated financial report for the last fiscal year.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Consolidated Reports
narrative_steps.description: Casey clicks on the 'View Consolidated Report' link from the dashboard.
narrative_steps.action: Click on 'View Consolidated Report'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The consolidated report view loads, showing summary tables and visualizations of total revenues, profits, and expenses.

narrative_steps.title: Setting Report Period
narrative_steps.description: Casey sets the date range for the report to cover the entire previous fiscal year.
narrative_steps.action: Select start and end dates for the fiscal year and click 'Refresh Report'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The report updates to show aggregated data for the selected period with stacked bar graphs comparing contributions.

requirement_tested: Cross-company comparison tools enabling users to compare financial performance
user_persona: A venture capitalist, Avery, evaluating investment opportunities among several startups.
user_goal: Avery wants to compare revenue and profit margins between three potential investments.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Comparison Tool
narrative_steps.description: Avery clicks on the 'Compare Companies' option from the dashboard menu.
narrative_steps.action: Click on 'Compare Companies'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The comparison tool opens with options to select companies and metrics.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Companies and Metrics
narrative_steps.description: Avery chooses 'StartupA', 'StartupB', and 'StartupC', then selects 'Revenue' and 'Profit' for comparison.
narrative_steps.action: Select companies and metrics from dropdowns.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A responsive table displays side-by-side values for selected metrics across the chosen companies.

requirement_tested: Interactive browsing interface for viewing individual company financial details
user_persona: An auditor, Logan, auditing financial records of a particular company.
user_goal: Logan needs to review detailed financial transactions for 'BuildIt Corp.' within a specific date range.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Detailed Financial View
narrative_steps.description: Logan clicks on BuildIt Corp.'s card from the dashboard to see detailed financial data.
narrative_steps.action: Click on BuildIt Corp. company card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Navigated to the company's detailed financial page showing transaction tables and trend visualizations.

narrative_steps.title: Filtering by Date Range
narrative_steps.description: Logan adjusts the date filter to focus only on Q2 2023 financials.
narrative_steps.action: Change the date filter to Q2 2023 and apply changes.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Financial data table reloads to show only entries from April 1 to June 30, 2023.

requirement_tested: Real-time data fetching from backend APIs with no hardcoded or mock data
user_persona: A portfolio manager, Skylar, monitoring live market impacts on holdings.
user_goal: Skylar wants assurance that the dashboard reflects the most current financial data without needing to refresh.

narrative_steps.title: Monitoring Live Updates
narrative_steps.description: Skylar keeps the dashboard open while waiting for end-of-day financial updates from multiple companies.
narrative_steps.action: Leave the dashboard open and observe periodic updates.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dashboard automatically refreshes every 60 seconds, updating displayed financial data with latest backend values.

requirement_tested: Styling with mint cream background and teal-colored UI components throughout the application
user_persona: A UX reviewer, Jamie, checking brand consistency across the platform.
user_goal: Jamie wants to verify that all UI components follow the specified color theme.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Dashboard Theme
narrative_steps.description: Jamie opens the dashboard and inspects the overall color scheme applied to backgrounds and interactive elements.
narrative_steps.action: Load the dashboard and visually inspect UI components.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Background color is consistently mint cream (#F5FFFA), and primary interactive elements like buttons and headers are styled in teal (#008080).

requirement_tested: Responsive design ensuring dashboard usability across different device sizes
user_persona: A remote worker, Quinn, accessing the dashboard from a tablet during travel.
user_goal: Quinn needs to use the dashboard effectively on a smaller touchscreen device.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Dashboard on Tablet
narrative_steps.description: Quinn opens the dashboard URL on a tablet browser.
narrative_steps.action: Open dashboard in tablet browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adapts to tablet screen size, rearranging components and adjusting font sizes for readability.

requirement_tested: Export functionality for financial reports in common formats (PDF, CSV)
user_persona: A compliance officer, Dakota, needing to archive quarterly reports.
user_goal: Dakota wants to download the consolidated report as a PDF for record keeping.

narrative_steps.title: Generating Consolidated Report
narrative_steps.description: Dakota generates the consolidated report for Q1 and views it on screen.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to consolidated report view and generate report.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Report displays correctly with summary tables and visualizations.

narrative_steps.title: Exporting to PDF
narrative_steps.description: Dakota clicks the 'Export as PDF' button to save a copy of the report.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Export as PDF' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A formatted PDF version of the report downloads automatically.

requirement_tested: Search and filtering capabilities for navigating financial data efficiently
user_persona: A researcher, Charlie, looking for specific financial entries among thousands.
user_goal: Charlie wants to find all transactions related to 'Marketing' expenses in 2023.

narrative_steps.title: Using Search Bar
narrative_steps.description: Charlie types 'Marketing' into the search bar at the top of the financial data listing.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'Marketing' into the search bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Results filter in real-time to show only entries matching the keyword 'Marketing'.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Additional Filters
narrative_steps.description: Charlie applies a date range filter to narrow results to the year 2023.
narrative_steps.action: Set date range filter from Jan 1 to Dec 31, 2023, and apply.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dataset further narrows down to show only Marketing-related entries within 2023.

requirement_tested: Configuration of package.json to support concurrent frontend and backend development startup
user_persona: A new developer, Morgan, joining the project and setting up the local environment.
user_goal: Morgan wants to easily install dependencies and start both frontend and backend services simultaneously.

narrative_steps.title: Installing All Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Morgan clones the repository and runs the command to install all frontend and backend dependencies.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` in the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dependencies for both client and server are installed successfully.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: After installation, Morgan starts both frontend and backend development servers with one command.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` in the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend servers start concurrently, ready for development work.
